attributes.action: Rescind the ban preventing servicemen and women from wearing their uniforms in Peterborough.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We feel that it is unjust that troops in Peterborough to have been banned from wearing their uniforms.

The servicemen and women of our armed forces have every reason to be proud of what they do and to receive the support of their local community.

Whilst there have been a few isolated incidents in which a few misguided individuals have been abusive towards personnel in public, it is not representative of the attitude of the citizenry of Peterborough at large.

We also call on the government to make available more resources to the local police to act against those being abusive towards troops and for penalties to be imposed on the perpetrators of what is essentially a hate crime.

rejection.details: This petition overlaps several aready in existence: http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/RespectForForces/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
